item.title: The HKTDC fairs for gifts, premiums, printing, and packaging draw in more than 60,000 buyers
item.description: Source: HKTDC. The 31st edition of the Hong Kong Gifts & Premium Fair and the 11th Hong Kong International Printing & Packaging Fair drew over 60,000 attendees from 134 countries and regions, according to the Hong Kong Trade Development Council (HKTDC). The Gifts Fair welcomed approximately 50,000 visitors, while the Printing & Packaging Fair saw over 14,000 attendees. Notably, there was increased participation from mainland China, Malaysia, the Philippines, and Indonesia.

item.title: The amount of money given as gifts for Chinese New Year in 2017 was calculated
item.description: Source: Gift Something blog post. Survey results for monetary gifts during Chinese New Year in Hong Kong. Values are in Hong Kong dollars. Gift Something, a Hong Kong-based online retailer specializing in premium gifts, conducted a survey to understand the practice of giving red envelopes (known as angpow or red packets in Singapore, and lai see or red pockets in Hong Kong) during Chinese New Year. Traditionally, married couples give these envelopes to unmarried individuals during the first 15 days of the Lunar New Year to bring luck.

item.title: Starbucks Singapore is launching a special, limited edition alice + olivia design collection
item.description: Starting January 31, 2015, Starbucks Singapore is offering a limited-edition collection of merchandise designed by Stacey Bendet, the CEO and Creative Director of alice + olivia. The collection incorporates the brand’s signature black-and-white color scheme and the famous ‘Stace Face’ logo, bringing a playful and whimsical touch to Starbucks merchandise. This special collection, which includes a ‘Stace Face’ mug, a reusable designer tote bag, and an alice + olivia Starbucks Rewards Card, is available at the Starbucks ION Orchard location.

item.title: Experience the flavors of an Italian Christmas at Casa Ferrero in Singapore
item.description: This year, Ferrero, the maker of Ferrero Rocher chocolates, has brought a touch of Italian Christmas magic to Singapore. Casa Ferrero, their only Southeast Asian pop-up shop, exudes elegance. The shop’s design echoes the gold of the classic Ferrero Rocher praline, enhanced by sparkling crystal chandeliers, the inviting aroma of espresso, and the distinct essence of roasted hazelnuts. Located outside the Wisma Atria mall along Orchard Road in Singapore, Casa Ferrero is even larger than last year’s pop-up, Pasticceria Ferrero.

item.title: Come to Singapore Gifts Show 2015 for a wide selection of corporate gifts
item.description: The upcoming Singapore Gifts Show (SGS) 2015 is the ideal event to discover this year’s corporate gift trends. Taking place from July 8th to 10th at Suntec Singapore, Halls 401 to 403, this international trade event offers free admission. item.title: There is a growing trend of adults purchasing toys and games
item.description: In 2016, games and puzzles experienced an 8% surge in the global market, surpassing construction toys as the fastest-growing toy category, according to Euromonitor International, a global market research firm. This impressive growth also marks the highest for the category since 2002. Although construction toys saw a growth of 7.8% in 2016, a dip compared to the double-digit growth of 2015, they still dominated the traditional toys and games market with a value of US$10 billion.

item.title: In India, Swarn Amrit produces sweets made with edible gold
item.description: Swarn Amrit, a high-end confectionery brand, has introduced a first-of-its-kind product line in India: sweets made with real 24-karat gold. The company believes that gold symbolizes purity, prosperity, and good fortune, and even suggests it may promote longevity. Swarn Kalash The new collection features a variety of sweets with names like kalash, mukhi, madhu, yukti, and katak, representing both Indian and international flavors. For example, Swarn Mukhi layers cashews, almonds, pistachios, and gold, while Swarn Madhu combines Belgian chocolate with gold, and Swarn Katak adds a touch of gold to Turkish delight.

item.title: Support World Vision in the Philippines by using the Gift It app to make a contribution
item.description: World Vision, a charitable organization, has teamed up with Gift It, a crowdgifting platform. Gift It allows users to create personalized campaigns to fund gifts from various stores or support charitable causes through foundation partners. Jun Godornes, World Vision’s Director for National Resources and Development, highlights the app’s convenience, stating it simplifies giving while raising awareness for their programs that support children through education, disaster relief, and economic development. Gift It also features a social aspect, enabling friends to contribute collaboratively.

item.title: Haldiram's is promoting mithai in India that is free from adulteration at SwaadMarket
item.description: Source: SwaadMarket.com website. Haldiram’s, a leading brand in the Indian sweets market, is now available on SwaadMarket.com. SwaadMarket is an Indian online marketplace that guarantees authentic, hygienic, and pure sweets and other food products. Giving Indian sweets (mithai) as gifts is a long-standing tradition, but recently the mithai market has declined due to a lack of new ideas and concerns about hygiene and purity. This trend inspired both companies to start promoting unadulterated sweets within India.

item.title: Giftano improves the experience of giving gifts
item.description: Giftano, a Singapore-based online gifting platform, has expanded its offerings to include a complete online gifting solution. In addition to their existing digital gift card selection, Giftano now features “Giftano Gifts,” a curated marketplace for physical presents. Giftano aims to provide a seamless and personalized online gifting experience, especially with the holiday season approaching. The company has improved its platform by adding a user-friendly search engine and features that allow for custom gift cards and various delivery choices.

item.title: Australian businesses have the option to utilize uChoose for their corporate rewards program
item.description: Source: uChoose website. i2c, a company providing card processing and new financial service solutions, partnered with Corporate Prepaid Solutions (CPS), a prepaid program manager, to launch the first of several corporate prepaid programs. This launch features the uChoose corporate rewards gift card in Australia. The uChoose card, enabled by i2c’s global processing platform, is a ready-made solution for companies wanting to provide a Visa-branded gift card. Businesses can personalize the card to match their branding.
